greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n such that (number of distinct parts) = least part.
comment: Also for n>0 the number of partitions of n such that (number of distinct parts) = multiplicity of the greatest part (by conjugation of the partition table). - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 28 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: b:= proc(n, i, d) option remember; `if`(min(i, n)<d+1, 0,
`if`(irem(n, i)=0 and i=d+1, 1, b(n, i-1, d)+
mathematica: z = 50; d[p_] := d[p] = Length[DeleteDuplicates[p]]; f[n_] := f[n] = IntegerPartitions[n];

b[n_, i_, d_] := b[n, i, d] = If[Min[i, n]<d+1, 0, If[Mod[n, i]==0 && i == d+1, 1, b[n, i-1, d] + Sum[b[n-i*j, i-1, d+1], {j, 1, n/i}]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n, 0]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 17 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 30 2014
